Submodules¶

Mikado.serializers.junction module¶

This module is necessary to serialise the junction information provided in BED12 format by programs such as TopHat or portcullis. Please convert any other (custom) format into BED12 before loading.

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

Simple serialization class for chromosomes.

is_equal(chrom, start, end, strand)[source]¶

Function to verify whether a set of coordinates is equal to those in the DB.

Parameters:
  • chrom (str) – chromosome
  • start (int) – start position (1-offset)
  • end (int) – end position (1-offset)
  • strand (str) – strand of the junction

class Mikado.serializers.junction.JunctionSerializer(handle, json_conf=None, logger=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class is used to serialize a junction BED12 file into an SQL database.

close()[source]¶

Closing method for with. It will close the handles, if they are defined. :return:

serialize()[source]¶

Workhorse of the class. It parses the input file and loads it into the database.

Mikado.serializers.orf module¶

This module contains the necessary classes for serialising and querying ORF data.

class Mikado.serializers.orf.Orf(bed12_object, query_id)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

Serialization class for ORFs derived from BED12 files.

as_bed12()[source]¶

Method to transform the mapper into a BED12 object.

classmethod as_bed12_static(state, query_name)[source]¶

Class method to transform the mapper into a BED12 object. Usable from outside the class.

Parameters:
  • state – the original state derived from the mapping.
  • query_name – the name of the query, retrieved from the Query associated object/table.

This class has the purpose of automating the loading of ORF information into the SQL database.

Module contents¶

This module contains the ORM modules necessary to create the starting DB from the input data.
